titleStmt.title: Telegram from William F. Cody to George T. Beck, January 22, 1896
titleStmt.author: Cody, William Frederick, 1846-1917
titleStmt.sponsor: Supported in part by a grant from the Wyoming Cultural Trust Fund, a program of the Department of State Parks and Cultural Resources.

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Cody, William Frederick, 1846-1917
bibl.title: Telegram from William F. Cody to George T. Beck

msIdentifier.repository: University of Wyoming, American Heritage Center, Beck Family Papers, 1858-1992 (bulk 1884-1919); Acc. #10386

div1.note:
Form 1. --For Type Writer Use.
Postal Telegraph-Cable Company. In Connection With The Commercial (MacKay-Bennett) Cables
TELEGRAM
All Messages taken by this Company are subject to the conditions printed on back of this Blank.
Albert B. Chandler, President and General Manager.
John O. Stevens, Secretary.
Send the following message, subject to the conditions on back, which are hereby agreed to.
______________189
div1.ab: 1427 F ST. N. W., WASH'N. D.C.
George.T.Beck, Chamberlins Ho tel, Washn, D. C.
div1.p: Be sure see Hursts2 wire result of meeting with secretary.

back.note: Note 1: Telegram is typewritten by clerk or William F. Cody assignee.

Note 2: "Hursts" refers to Phoebe Apperson Hearst (1842-1919) and George Hearst (1820-1891), California senator and Comstock Lode magnate. At Beck's request, Phoebe Hearst agreed to provide an indemnity bond of $30,000 at 7.5% for the Shoshone Irrigation Company project.
